oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Diversity-Oriented Approach to Novel Spirocyclics via Enyne Metathesis, Diels-Alder Reaction, and a [2+2+2] Cycloaddition as Key Steps
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
ALI, R
TIWARI, A
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: spirocyclic compounds
[2+2+2]-cycloaddition reaction
rongalite
enyne metathesis
Diels-Alder reaction
AMINO-ACID DERIVATIVES
RING-CLOSING METATHESIS
FREDERICAMYCIN-A
MOLECULAR FRAMEWORKS
GLYCINE EQUIVALENT
ORGANIC-SYNTHESIS
O-QUINODIMETHANE
TIC DERIVATIVES
FENESTRANES
EXPANSION
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A simple protocol for the synthesis of indane-based spirocyclics has been developed via enyne metathesis, Diels-Alder reaction, and a [2+2+2] cycloaddition as key steps starting from indane-1,3-dione. The key diene building block was assembled by enyne metathesis. In this sequence, rongalite is used as a green reagent to prepare the sultine intermediate, which is a useful precursor to generate the transient diene.
